intro: Hedyotis diffusa, commonly known as Indian pennywort, is a small flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Hedyotis diffusa is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
